sen.j: 田能村竹田（たのむら ちくでん、安永6年6月10日 (旧暦)（1777年7月14日） - 天保6年8月29日 (旧暦)（1835年10月20日））は、江戸時代後期の南画（文人画）家。
sen.e: Chikuden TANOMURA (July 14, 1777 - October 20, 1835) was a painter of nanga (a school of painting originating in China) (literati painting), who lived during the late Edo period.
Chikuden TANOMURA (July 14, 1777 - October 20, 1835) was a painter of nanga (a school of painting originating in China) (literati painting), who lived during the late Edo period.
Chikuden TANOMURA (July 14, 1777 - October 20, 1835) was a painter of nanga (a school of painting originating in China) (literati painting), who lived during the late Edo period.
His first name was Takanori (孝憲).
sen.cmt: 孝憲→正式な読み方が不明です：Takanori (孝憲)としました。
sen.e: His first name was Takanori (孝憲).
His first name was Takanori (孝憲).

His azana (Chinese courtesy name, which was, historically the name formerly given to adult Chinese men, used in place of their given name in formal situations, scholars and the literati of Japan adopted this custom of courtesy name) was Kuni.

His azana (Chinese courtesy name, which was, historically the name formerly given to adult Chinese men, used in place of their given name in formal situations, scholars and the literati of Japan adopted this custom of courtesy name) was Kuni.

His azana (Chinese courtesy name, which was, historically the name formerly given to adult Chinese men, used in place of their given name in formal situations, scholars and the literati of Japan adopted this custom of courtesy name) was Kuni.
His common name was Takezo.
His common name was Takezo.
His common name was Takezo.

sen.j: 別号は老画師・九畳・仙史など。
sen.e: His different pseudonyms were Roeshi (master painter), Kujo (nine Japanese tatami mat), Senshi, and others.
His different pseudonyms were Roeshi (master painter), Kujo (nine Japanese tatami mat), Senshi, and others.
His different pseudonyms were Roeshi (master painter), Kujo (nine Japanese tatami mat), Senshi, and others.

sen.j: 豊後国岡藩の藩医の家に生まれ、藩校の由学館で学び同校の儒員から頭取まで進んだ。
sen.e: He was born in a family of a doctor of the Oka Domain, Bungo Province, and after having learned at hanko (a domain school), Yugakukan, he served the same school, starting as juin (Confucianist staff) and reaching to todori (the school chief).

He was born in a family of a doctor of the Oka Domain, Bungo Province, and after having learned at hanko (a domain school), Yugakukan, he served the same school, starting as juin (Confucianist staff) and reaching to todori (the school chief).

He was born in a family of a doctor of the Oka Domain, Bungo Province, and after having learned at hanko (a domain school), Yugakukan, he served the same school, starting as juin (Confucianist staff) and reaching to todori (the school chief).

sen.j: また儒学を学ぶため熊本や京都に遊学もしている。
sen.e: He also traveled to Kumamoto and Kyoto to study Confucianism.
He also traveled to Kumamoto and Kyoto to study Confucianism.
He also traveled to Kumamoto and Kyoto to study Confucianism.

sen.j: この間『豊後国志』の編纂に携わり、また、地元の画家に画を学び、江戸の谷文晁に現在でいう通信教育まで受けている。
sen.e: During this period, while he was engaged in the compilation of "Bungo Kokushi" (Bungo provincial history), he learned painting under a local painter, and even sought a distance instruction of Buncho TANI in Edo (present Tokyo), which can be compared to today's correspondence education.

During this period, while he was engaged in the compilation of "Bungo Kokushi" (Bungo provincial history), he learned painting under a local painter, and even sought a distance instruction of Buncho TANI in Edo (present Tokyo), which can be compared to today's correspondence education.

During this period, while he was engaged in the compilation of "Bungo Kokushi" (Bungo provincial history), he learned painting under a local painter, and even sought a distance instruction of Buncho TANI in Edo (present Tokyo), which can be compared to today's correspondence education.

sen.j: 1811年（文化 (元号)8年）専売制度に反対して藩内に農民一揆が発生し、その際改革を要求する建言書を藩に2度提出したが受け入れられず、1812年（文化9年）辞表を提出した。
sen.e: In 1811, when a peasants uprising opposing to the monopolization broke out in the domain, he submitted the proposition to the domain government twice calling for a reform, however, they are not accepted and he tendered his resignation.
sen.cmt: 藩→domain government としました。
sen.e: In 1811, when a peasants uprising opposing to the monopolization broke out in the domain, he submitted the proposition to the domain government twice calling for a reform, however, they were not accepted and he tendered his resignation.

In 1811, when a peasants uprising opposing to the monopolization broke out in the domain, he submitted the proposition to the domain government twice calling for a reform, however, they were not accepted and he tendered his resignation.

sen.j: それ以後豊後と京阪との間を行き来しながら、岡田米山人・岡田半江・浦上春琴・頼山陽・菅茶山・青木木米などの文人たちと交流を持ち、大阪の藩邸で亡くなった。
sen.e: Since then, he traveled back and forth between Bungo Province and Keihan (Kyoto and Osaka) area, having cultural exchanges with literary figures such as Beisanjin OKADA, Hanko OKADA, Shunkin URAGAMI, Sanyo RAI, Chazan KAN and Mokubei AOKI, and died at hantei (the official residence maintained by a feudal lord) of the Oka clan in Osaka.

Since then, he traveled back and forth between Bungo Province and Keihan (Kyoto and Osaka) area, having cultural exchanges with literary figures such as Beisanjin OKADA, Hanko OKADA, Shunkin URAGAMI, Sanyo RAI, Chazan KAN and Mokubei AOKI, and died at hantei (the official residence maintained by a feudal lord) of the Oka clan in Osaka.

Since then, he traveled back and forth between Bungo Province and Keihan (Kyoto and Osaka) area, having cultural exchanges with literary figures such as Beisanjin OKADA, Hanko OKADA, Shunkin URAGAMI, Sanyo RAI, Chazan KAN and Mokubei AOKI, and died at hantei (the official residence maintained by a feudal lord) of the Oka clan in Osaka.
